## 사건 정보

**사건명**: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Eugene S. KYSLINGER, Appellant
**판결일**: 1984-11-20
**법원**: Supreme Court of Pennsylvania
**관할**: Pennsylvania, PA

**판사**: Flaherty, Hutchinson, Larsen, McDERMOTT, Nix, Papadakos, Zappala

## 변호인

Gary B. Zimmerman, Pittsburgh, for appellant., Robert E. Colville, Dist. Atty., Robert L. Eberhardt, Deputy Dist. Atty., Dara A. DeCourcy, Asst. Dist. Atty., Kemal Alexander, Mericli, Melinda G. Tell, Pittsburgh, for appellee.

## 인용

- 484 A.2d 389
- 506 Pa. 132

## 판결문 요약


506 Pa. 132 (1984)
484 A.2d 389
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee,
v.
Eugene S. KYSLINGER, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 9, 1984.
Decided November 20, 1984.
*133 Gary B. Zimmerman, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Robert E. Colville, Dist. Atty., Robert L. Eberhardt, Deputy Dist. Atty., Dara A. DeCourcy, Asst. Dist. Atty., Kemal Alexander, Mericli, Melinda G. Tell, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN FLAHERTY McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.


*134 OPINION OF THE COURT
FLAHERTY, Justice.
In a trial by jury in the Court of Common Pleas of Allegheny County, the appellant, Eugene S. Kyslinger, was convicted of issuing a check with the knowledge that the check would be dishonored by the drawee, 18 Pa.C.S.A. § 4105, and a sentence of one to five years imprisonment was imposed. Superior Court affirmed the judgment of sentence. Commonwealth v. Kyslinger, 305 Pa.Super. 626, 450 A.2d 1066 (1982). The instant appeal ensued.[*]
The events which culminated in appellant's issuance of the check in question were, in relevant part, as follows. Appellant, as president and sole owner of T.I.C. Corporation, a coal brokerage firm located in Pittsburgh, had a contract to supply coal to the United States Steel Corporation. To obtain the necessary coal, the appellant, on behalf of his company, entered into a contract with K.O.C., a company, located in Kentucky, which mines and supplies coal, operated by Mr. Cecil Lane.
Shortly after the c...
